result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott D McGee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Homicide by Intoxicated Use of Vehicle, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.09(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant shall obtain and maintain full time employment.

Defendant shall have no direct or indirect contact with Marvin K. or his extended family or any of their residences.

Defendant shall not purchase, possess or consume any form of alcohol or intoxicants, possession includes items within your residence, vehicle or other property under your control.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol or controlled substance without a valid prescription and then taken as prescribed.

Defendant shall not enter any premises where primary purpose is sale or distribution of alcohol, including but not limited to bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents without agent approval.  

Defendant shall not attend any festival, event, party, concert, wedding or place that sells and/or serves alcohol without prior agent approval.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent and comply with treatment recommendations.

Defendant shall submit to random drug and alcohol screens.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.

Defendant shall pay any supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA assessment and safety plan.

Outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all prison wages at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision.  If extended supervision is revoked or will discharge with financial obligations owing, a judgment shall be entered.

Restitution amount to be determined at the Restitution Hearing on November 17, 2015 at 2:00 p.m.  Per Court at November 17, 2015 restitution hearing restitution determined to be $17,191.03 plus the 10% surcharge.

supervisions.notes: Effective upon licensure.  Attached is an information sheet for the defendant regarding installation.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA assessment and safety plan.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Daniel Morgan Adams.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth and Atty Mandy A Schepper for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  State request $30,000-40,000.00 cash bond and defendant currently on probation.  Atty. Adams request signature bond with electronic monitoring.  State makes further argument for cash bond and there is not a probation hold at this time.  Court orders $40,000.00 cash bond.   Preliminary hearing time limits waived.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 08:15 am.
